quotes: Until December 2023, he was Chief Executive of Oxfam GB.
Sriskandarajah then attended the University of Sydney, from which he graduated with a Bachelor of Economics and Social Science in 1998.
During 1995 and 1996, he resided at Wesley College, a residential college within, but separate from, the university.
Sriskandarajah was educated at James Ruse Agricultural High School in Carlingford, New South Wales, Australia, graduating in 1993.
Spouse Suzanne Lambert (m. 2003)
Sriskandarajah is the author of the book Power to the People, published in 2024.
Sriskandarajah held various posts from 2004 to 2009, including Deputy Director of the left-leaning think tank, the Institute for Public Policy Research.
He was Director General of the Royal Commonwealth Society, from 2009 to 2012, the youngest ever person and the first non-Briton to head this 140-year-old organisation.
He was the Secretary General of CIVICUS, a global alliance of civil society organisations from January 2013 to December 2018.
He was previously a member of the High Level Panel on Humanitarian Finance from 2015 to 2016.
Sriskandarajah was Chief Executive of Oxfam GB from January 2019 to December 2023.
He was appointed Chief Executive of the New Economics Foundation in January 2024.
On 16 August 2003, Sriskandarajah married Trinidadian barrister Suzanne Julia Lambert in Trinidad, West Indies.
Oxfam GB (Press release). 15 June 2023

roles.title: Chief Exec
quotes: New Economics Foundation appoints Dr Danny Sriskandarajah as new Chief Exec
Dhananjayan Sivaguru Sriskandarajah (born December 1975) is a Tamil Sri Lankan-born British-Australian activist who is the Chief Executive of the New Economics Foundation.
Danny Sriskandarajah was born in Sri Lanka, the son of Sri Lankan Tamil parents who first moved to Australia as doctoral students.
Dhananjayan Sivaguru Sriskandarajah (born December 1975) is a Tamil Sri Lankan-born British-Australian activist who is the Chief Executive of the New Economics Foundation.
Danny Sriskandarajah was born in Sri Lanka, the son of Sri Lankan Tamil parents who first moved to Australia as doctoral students.
Sriskandarajah was educated at James Ruse Agricultural High School in Carlingford, New South Wales, Australia, graduating in 1993.
He was the first non-British and youngest person to head the Royal Commonwealth Society, a large non-governmental organisation (NGO) devoted to Commonwealth affairs, based in London, England.
On 16 August 2003, Sriskandarajah married Trinidadian barrister Suzanne Julia Lambert in Trinidad, West Indies.

roles.title: head
quotes: He was the first non-British and youngest person to head the Royal Commonwealth Society, a large non-governmental organisation (NGO) devoted to Commonwealth affairs, based in London, England.
Dhananjayan Sivaguru Sriskandarajah (born December 1975) is a Tamil Sri Lankan-born British-Australian activist who is the Chief Executive of the New Economics Foundation.
Danny Sriskandarajah was born in Sri Lanka, the son of Sri Lankan Tamil parents who first moved to Australia as doctoral students.
Dhananjayan Sivaguru Sriskandarajah (born December 1975) is a Tamil Sri Lankan-born British-Australian activist who is the Chief Executive of the New Economics Foundation.
Danny Sriskandarajah was born in Sri Lanka, the son of Sri Lankan Tamil parents who first moved to Australia as doctoral students.
Sriskandarajah was educated at James Ruse Agricultural High School in Carlingford, New South Wales, Australia, graduating in 1993.
He was the first non-British and youngest person to head the Royal Commonwealth Society, a large non-governmental organisation (NGO) devoted to Commonwealth affairs, based in London, England.
Sriskandarajah held various posts from 2004 to 2009, including Deputy Director of the left-leaning think tank, the Institute for Public Policy Research.
He was Director General of the Royal Commonwealth Society, from 2009 to 2012, the youngest ever person and the first non-Briton to head this 140-year-old organisation.
He was the Secretary General of CIVICUS, a global alliance of civil society organisations from January 2013 to December 2018.
He was previously a member of the High Level Panel on Humanitarian Finance from 2015 to 2016.
Sriskandarajah was Chief Executive of Oxfam GB from January 2019 to December 2023.
He was appointed Chief Executive of the New Economics Foundation in January 2024.
On 16 August 2003, Sriskandarajah married Trinidadian barrister Suzanne Julia Lambert in Trinidad, West Indies.
